Happy.description: Happiness is a feeling of joy, pleasure, or contentment. People often smile when they are happy.
key_features: Corners of the mouth pulled up (smile)
Wrinkles may appear around the eyes ('crow's feet')

Sad.description: Sadness is feeling unhappy or sorrowful. Sometimes people cry when they are sad.
key_features: Inner corners of eyebrows pulled up and together
Corners of the mouth pulled down
Lower lip may tremble or push out (pout)
Eyes may appear droopy or teary

Angry.description: Anger is a strong feeling of annoyance, displeasure, or hostility.
key_features: Eyes may stare intensely or narrow ('glare')
Lips pressed firmly together or opened to show teeth

Surprise.description: Surprise is feeling astonished by something unexpected.
key_features: Mouth opened, often forming an 'O' shape

Neutral.description: Neutral means not feeling strongly one way or another. The face is often relaxed.
key_features: Mouth closed or slightly parted naturally

Fear.description: Fear is feeling afraid or worried that something dangerous or unpleasant might happen.
key_features: Upper eyelids raised, lower eyelids tensed
Eyes wide, showing more white above the iris
Mouth corners pulled back horizontally, lips may be stretched

Disgust.description: Disgust is a feeling of revulsion or strong disapproval aroused by something unpleasant or offensive.
